profileType.description: Set up your MindHive profile by selecting one of the options below. Are you creating a personal profile for yourself, or setting up a page for your organization?

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: This profile is most appropriate when you are creating an account to represent a community organization or company.

individual.title: Individual
individual.description: This profile is most appropriate when you are creating an account for yourself.

basic.description: Please complete the following items to create your profile and connect with the MindHive community.
basic.title: Basic Information
basic.subtitle: Your basic information helps the MindHive community get to know you better. This includes who you are, where you're located, and what you look like.

background.title: Background
background.description: Let's get to know you better! Please fill out your background information so others in the MindHive community can connect with you more easily.

officialBio.title: Official Bio
officialBio.description: In ~100 words, describe your expertise, experience, and educational background for a high school audience.

unofficialBio.title: Unofficial Bio
unofficialBio.description: In a couple of sentences, describe your journey leading to where you are now, professionally. And look ahead to the next 5 years or beyond. The goal is for students to understand that professional lives are not always a straight path and that there are coincidences, good luck and bad luck, and sometimes multiple career paths hidden behind official bios you might read on a scientist's website.

introduction.title: Introduction Video
introduction.description: We'd love for you to upload an introduction video to share with students and fellow MindHive members. You can use it to share a project you think students might get excited about.
introduction.videoNotSupported: Your browser does not support the video tag.

passion.title: What are you passionate about right now?
passion.description: For example, you can briefly describe a science project you are working on. Or you can tell us about your experience bringing science to the public. This is your space to showcase what you're currently working on and how it shapes the expertise you bring to our community.

videoUploader.dragAndDrop: Drag and drop video file to upload
videoUploader.error: There was an error with the video upload. Please try again.

preferences.title: Your Involvement
preferences.description: Please complete the following items to let us know the details of your involvement.

availability.title: Please indicate below how you are available to partner with us (select all that apply).

async.title: Asynchronous
async.answeringQuestions: Answering student questions (based on your profile).

sync.title: Synchronous
sync.inPersonVisit: Making an in-class visit to talk with program students about your work (in-person).
sync.zoomVisit: Making an in-class visit to talk with program students about your work (over Zoom).

gradeLevel.title: Grade Level
gradeLevel.description: Tell us about the grade levels you feel most comfortable supporting as a mentor. Select all that apply.

groupPreference.title: Individual vs Group
groupPreference.description: Do you prefer supporting individuals or groups in mentorship sessions? Select all that apply.

classType.title: Class Type
classType.description: Tell us about what type of classroom you would most like to mentor. Select all that apply.

interests.title: Where can you help?
interests.description: What topics would you like to support students with? Select some topics and areas of interest from the list below to let other community members know where you're excited to contribute. This will help us connect you with students and peers who share your passions.

interestSelector.placeholder: Begin typing to search for interests

connectSubtitle: Search for, discover, and connect with the MindHive community
searchPlaceholder: Search by name, topic, or area of interest
videoNotSupported: Your browser does not support the video tag.
passionNow: What are you passionate about right now?
asyncAnsweringQuestions: Answering student questions (based on your profile).
syncInPersonVisit: Making an in-class visit to talk with program students about your work (in-person).
syncZoomVisit: Making an in-class visit to talk with program students about your work (over Zoom).
